title: special chars
body:
### expected behaviour
i would upload files with special chars

### actual behaviour
client spits "server error" and loops forever trying to upload files

### steps to reproduce
1. have file with turkish chars in it (s with something under, capital i with accent)
2. try to sync that dir
3. 

### server configuration
operating system:
debian 7

web server: 
apache 2.2

database:
mysql 5.5.31

php version:
php 5.4.4-14+deb7u4 (cli) (built: aug 26 2013 07:40:51)

owncloud version:
5.0.12

locale -a says
c
c.utf-8
en_us.utf8
posix

the warning in the admin interface about utf8 is not there again. the server was rebooted several times after adding utf8.

### client configuration
browser:

operating system:
windows 2k3
client 1.4.2
### logs

since it was hogging all the bandwidth, i resorted to rename the files removing offending chars. currently have no log since sync is working on renamed files.

#### web server error log
despite client message, no errors in webserver error log.

the only error is about my ssl certificate not matching the name of the server, this is ok in my setup.

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)

the only errors here are about search_lucene. i disabled it with no results.
